page.title: 16The New Library in Bingley
page.content: The present library was built in 1972 above the new Shopping Centre, and is used by approximately 30% of the local population. It is divided into an adult and children's sections, reading area, reference library and exhibition area. Each day the library takes copies of daily newspapers. The papers are read by many people, including the elderly and particularly, these days, by people looking for jobs. Books are issued by computer and may be kept for three weeks after which a fine is charged. The most popular author in the adult fiction section is Catherine Cookson and in the children's section, Roald Dahl. Exhibitions of paintings, pottery and other crafts are held regularly.
